required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Induction Study of Mirikizumab in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis (LUCENT 1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel, Placebo-Controlled Induction Study of Mirikizumab in Conventional-Failed and Biologic-Failed Patients With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis (LUCENT 1)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Mirikizumab in participants with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis (UC) who have had an inadequate response to, loss of response, or intolerant to conventional or biologic therapy for UC.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Clinical Remission
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission based on the modified Mayo Score (MMS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Clinical Response
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response based on the MMS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Endoscopic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission based on the MMS Endoscopic Subscore (ES).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Symptomatic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission based on MMS Stool Frequency (SF) and Rectal Bleeding (RB) subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Symptomatic Response
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic response based on MMS SF and RB subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Mucosal Healing
secondary_outcome.description: Mucosal healing based on a histologic disease activity index.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Endoscopic Response
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic response based on the MMS ES.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 12 in UC Symptoms: Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: UC symptoms based on NRS scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 12 in Health Related Quality of Life: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Health Related Quality of Life based on IBDQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 12 in Fecal Calprotectin
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to Week 12 in fecal calprotectin.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0, 4, 8 and 12: Pre-Dose; Week 0 and 4: Up to 2 hour Post-Dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of UC for at least 3 months prior to baseline.
- Confirmed diagnosis of moderately or severely active UC, as assessed by the modified Mayo score (MMS).
- Demonstrated an inadequate response to, a loss of response to, or an intolerance to conventional or to biologic therapy for UC.
- If female, must meet the contraception requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with a current diagnosis of Crohn's disease or inflammatory bowel disease-unclassified (indeterminate colitis).
- Participants with a previous colectomy.
- Participants with current evidence of toxic megacolon.
- Prior exposure to anti-IL12p40 antibodies (e.g. ustekinumab) or anti-IL-23p19 antibodies (e.g. risankizumab, brazikumab, guselkumab or tildrakizumab).

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
